content: Marriage Bill Heads to Connecticut Senate March 31, 2009 A bill that would reconcile Connecticut marriage law with a court ruling allowing same-sex marriage won approval in the state senate judiciary committee on Monday and is now headed to a vote in the full senate. The committee voted 30-10 for the measure, which removes gender references from marriage laws and converts existing same-sex civil unions in the state to legally recognized marriages.
